cyclone.name: BONNIE
cyclone.current_location: about 195 miles SSE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest toward the South Carolina coast, then forecast to turn northeast and track along/off the coasts of North Carolina and the Mid-Atlantic before moving back over the western Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central South Carolina coast (around Charleston/Georgetown)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River, GA to Little River Inlet, SC (tropical-storm warning area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coastline from northern Georgia through the Outer Banks of North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: No significant tropical-storm-force winds expected; only occasional breezy conditions from peripheral gradient flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: None to very light outer-band showers possible; heavy rain core will remain well north of the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip-current risk along local beaches.
